column4: can someone explain how I have 2 battery notifications on my laptop, 1 (battery charge monitor) says I have over 3 hours of battery left 99% charged, the other (power management) says I have 55 minutes left 97% charged? (x3)
The 55 minute one is for the time remaining till full charge, ignore it
thanks :)
The discharge meters are pretty accurate though
I've been dealing with battery issues for several months now and got a 3rd replacement battery, was curious why ubuntu was reporting different times, thought maybe this battery was snafu too!
Nah prob not
Your BIOS probably limits charging above a certain % too (why it says 55 minutes vs say 10)
I think it does, there is an option to "calibrate battery" in there that makes no sense to me.
would you know why I can't ping my workstation by netbios name when I connect over VPN?
I can ping the workstations IP, but not netbios name.
Yeah, Ubuntu does the DNS stuff differently than windows, prob nothing you can do about it
yeah, I was thinking ubuntu couldn't see the alt. dns names for our domain.
you could add the DNS server to your list --- not sure what that would do if its not available (ie not connected)
the weird thing is I can ping.. say our MS Exchange server by netbios name, but not my workstation lol
System --> Admin --> Networking --> DNS
add the DNS server
thanks, I'll give it a try now. My apologize if I disconnect from here (as it usually does when I connect to VPNc) Thanks so much for the help :)
Open the EXE with the archive viewer thing
ok, thanks :D
archive manager can't open it :(
winrar can open it
See if you can run that in wine or something
Ask one of the guys in ##windows to open it and extract the INF for you
hehe ok
